tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Did you know about this on 26th November as reported by the Guardian? In which case why has it taken 9 days to act in he face of such devastation?

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil More of this please.  Far too much of this is just not pursued.  There must be clear consequences for this desecration of what‚Äôs left of the natural environment.  It is precious and must be fought for.

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text: @RichardTreeArt @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Possibly because all funding has been pulled, everyone is stretched beyond decency and there's this covid stuff going on

@JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil It wasn‚Äôt your home that had been flooded twice in 3 years! This work should have been done by the EA, not wasting time and money investigating work they didn‚Äôt have the balls to complete

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Please take action on this. Send a message to others that they will not be able to get away with it. Just slapping a fine on a rich landowner will not make a dent. We're depending on you, so please do this properly, publically and to the full extent of the law.

tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well done - EA Drone operator surveying damage at River Lugg at Kingsland site this afternoon - picture editors more at Alamy Live News @guardian @guardianphotos #riverlugg @TelegraphPics https://t.co/SBFVor1VIu

Curiouser and curiouser.

Farmer claims that he was given permission to dredge the riverbed and reprofile the bank by the @EnvAgency "I have been allowed to do by the Environment Agency", he says. (1/2)

https://t.co/cxiwV3YF4M
@denny_robert @Nelliefarmhouse @NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Anyone know who did it yet? Appalling.

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Perhaps someone who has shown such cruelty to the land should have their land confiscated and be banned from owning land for 10 years.

Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read: https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY  
 
#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/9ILpU5ivbX

tweets.text:
On the 5th anniversary of Storm Desmond, work continues to progress well on new flood defences along the River Lune. 

In the next few weeks we should achieve 'technical completion' of the ¬£11million scheme with the installation of a new flood gate at the Holiday Inn. https://t.co/RcHclPHZc4

Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/qatD7dFz4V https://t.co/6aBDazcQ4T

urls.title: Flood and Coastal Engineering | Brunel University London
urls.description: This exciting new funded programme, developed in partnership with the Environment Agency will equip you with the knowledge you need for a successful career in flood risk management.

tweets.text:
In 2015 Storm Desmond hit Cumbria flooding many areas including the town of #Egremont. 
 
5 years on and #TeamEA are investing 12 million on a flood scheme for the town with works ongoing to better protect 220 properties from flooding. 
 
For more info - https://t.co/UibqT7Itw6 https://t.co/kDcqp2sM3E

urls.title: Cumbria | The Flood Hub
urls.description: This local spaces area will provide information o n our aim to manage flood risk on a catchment scale from Source to Sea. In this section we will introduce you to Cumbria Strategic Flood Partnership, a collective of organisations that coordinates all flood risk management planning and delivery and detailed information on Flood Risk Management Schemes being delivered.

@southloughtoncc @EssexCCB @EnvAgencySE @LoughtonRA @eppingforestdc The river is high and fast down our end too. The issue appears to be that the river is far too responsive to rain. This suggests that a catchment wide approach is needed to slow the water. Planting trees, blocking drainage ditches, leaky dams etc

@Gad__fly @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Like I say this is a the bank of a fenland drain, it's a small patch that becomes a wildflower and inverterbrate haven on hundreds of miles of such drains. They could just leave the mowing two weeks and it would be enriched. They spend a lot of time looking after the watervoles

tweets.text:
On 03/12/20 at 09:45 the river level was 0.12m.

We have had one day of steady but not torrential rain. How can the river rise 1.21 metres in that time? Yet again we have water in our pavilion as a result. VERY worrying. @EssexCCB @EnvAgencySE @LoughtonRA @eppingforestdc https://t.co/l91kbJDr7Y https://t.co/IRHkkS2sWI

@sciencebase @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Ok sorry-my bad! Because you said "bed down naturally" I'd jumped to conclusion you didn't understand about nutrient removal etc, so when I saw you were a science writer & interested in wildlife, I was a bit incredulous - but you're right I shouldn't have jumped to conclusions!

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.
